Member Function Documentation

void GrUberPatchSet::CacheTiles ( const GrCamera *  camera,
unsigned int  screenWidth,
unsigned int  screenHeight 
)

calculates tile LOD and then caches tiles.

bias.

get the current look direction. We can use this to perform an early rejection of some patches (we can simply exclude patches facing away from the camera).

calculate minimum width and height (one pixel).

get the field of view and calculate LOD distance function.

for each patch.

determine if we can reject the current patch entirely.

check to see if the current patch is in the view frustum. If not, we can simply skip the current patch.

calculate the number of texels in the patch along each axis.

determine the maximum LOD and the falloff function based on the size of the bounding box on the screen.

get the corners of the box, transformed into screen space.

calculate the bounding volume in screen space.

cache all tiles based on their LODs.

draw the current AA-Box.

finally calculate the LOD for the current patch.

project the position on the approximate plane into texture space.

calculate the size of the LOD boxes in texture space.

intersect the approximate plane with the sphere to determine the falloff size.

calculate the circle's radius in tile space.

clamp the circle radius at 8 so that we never end up with groups larger than 16x16 tiles.

simply use the AA-box of the circle, clipped to the current patch's bounds, for tile caching.

skip the current group if the current tile is outside of patch.

adjust tiles by the LOD.

print out statistics if necessary.

request tiles.

void GrUberPatchSet::Load ( UReader &  reader  ) 

load/save functionality.

free anything that was previously allocated.

read in the patch count.

read in the total number of tiles per meter.

allocate space for patch data and read it in.

load each ubertexture.

now read the data.

get the ubertexture patch info.

load world data.

set the world transform to identity by default.
